snippet: Laxatives are taking their place in the ad world, alongside toilet paper, condoms, tampons, flushable wipes and other previously silent products.
abstract: Stuart Elliott Advertising column highlights the $4 million campaign for Senokot brands of laxative tablets sold by Purdue products; notes that ads for products like laxatives, toilet paper, condoms and tampons have become more forthcoming as societal attitudes on what can be discussed in public have significantly changed.
lead_paragraph: Laxatives are taking their place in the ad world, alongside toilet paper, condoms, tampons, flushable wipes and other previously silent products.

headline.main: In a Forthright Campaign, More Unmentionables Mentioned
